(وَاعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُشْرِكُوا بِهِ شَيْئًا ۖ وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا وَبِذِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْيَتَامَىٰ وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَالْجَارِ ذِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْجَارِ الْجُنُبِ وَالصَّاحِبِ بِالْجَنْبِ وَابْنِ السَّبِيلِ وَمَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ مَنْ كَانَ مُخْتَالًا فَخُورًا)
[سورة النساء 36]

And serve Allah. Ascribe no thing as partner unto Him. (Show) kindness unto parents, and unto near kindred, and orphans, and the needy, and into the neighbor who is of kin (unto you) and the neighbor who is not of kin and the fellow traveller and the wayfarer and (the slaves) whom your right hands possess. Lo! Allah loveth not such as are proud and boastful....
صدق الله العظيم

Exactly. Middle east has been suffering from terrorism since pretty much ALWAYS. Have you ever seen Facebook stading for any of these? Such a shame! People using the hashtag pray for the world just because of the recent attacks in Paris? So that's what it takes for them to realize we need to pray for the world? That's ridiculous. I do feel sorry for the terrorists attacks in Paris but I also feel sorry for the whole middle east, all the innocent lives being taken every single day. I'm not part of this hypocrite movement "pray for France" when middle east has been needing it for way way longer. It's like these people close their eyes for what's really happening and they only see what they want. Ugh.

My heart and prayers go out to them as well.

Just like Chicago,  don't be mad at guns, solve the gang violence problem. Sorry for pointing out the truth.
